Him that is weak<S>770</S> in the faith<S>4102</S> receive ye<S>4355</S>, but <S>1161</S> not<S>3361</S> to<S>1519</S> doubtful<S>1261</S> disputations<S>1253</S>. <sup>not: or, not to judge his doubtful thoughts</sup>
For<S>3303</S> one<S>3739</S> believeth<S>4100</S> that he may eat<S>5315</S> all things<S>3956</S>: another<S>1161</S>, who is weak<S>770</S>, eateth<S>2068</S> herbs<S>3001</S>.
Let<S>1848</S> not<S>3361</S> him that eateth<S>2068</S> despise<S>1848</S> him that eateth<S>2068</S> not<S>3361</S>; and<S>2532</S> let<S>2068</S> not<S>3361</S> him which eateth<S>2068</S> not<S>3361</S> judge<S>2919</S> him that eateth<S>2068</S>: for<S>1063</S> God<S>2316</S> hath received<S>4355</S> him<S>846</S>.
Who<S>5101</S> art<S>1488</S> thou<S>4771</S> that judgest<S>2919</S> another man's<S>245</S> servant<S>3610</S>? to his own<S>2398</S> master<S>2962</S> he standeth<S>4739</S> or<S>2228</S> falleth<S>4098</S>. Yea<S>1161</S>, he shall be holden up<S>2476</S>: for<S>1063</S> God<S>2316</S> is<S>2076</S> able<S>1415</S> to make<S>2476</S> him<S>846</S> stand<S>2476</S>.
One<S>3303</S> man<S>3739</S> esteemeth<S>2919</S> one day<S>2250</S> above<S>3844</S> another<S>2250</S>:<S>1161</S> another<S>3739</S> esteemeth<S>2919</S> every<S>3956</S> day<S>2250</S> alike. Let<S>4135</S> every man<S>1538</S> be fully persuaded<S>4135</S> in<S>1722</S> his own<S>2398</S> mind<S>3563</S>. <sup>fully persuaded: or, fully assured</sup>
He that regardeth<S>5426</S> the day<S>2250</S>, regardeth<S>5426</S> it unto the Lord<S>2962</S>; and<S>2532</S> he that regardeth<S>5426</S> not<S>3361</S> the day<S>2250</S>, to the Lord<S>2962</S> he doth<S>5426</S> not<S>3756</S> regard<S>5426</S> it. He that eateth<S>2068</S>, eateth<S>2068</S> to the Lord<S>2962</S>, for<S>1063</S> he giveth God<S>2316</S> thanks<S>2168</S>; and<S>2532</S> he that eateth<S>2068</S> not<S>3361</S>, to the Lord<S>2962</S> he eateth<S>2068</S> not<S>3756</S>, and<S>2532</S> giveth God<S>2316</S> thanks<S>2168</S>. <sup>regardeth: or, observeth</sup>
For<S>1063</S> none<S>3762</S> of us<S>2257</S> liveth<S>2198</S> to himself<S>1438</S>, and<S>2532</S> no man<S>3762</S> dieth<S>599</S> to himself<S>1438</S>.
For<S>1063</S> whether<S>1437</S> <S>5037</S> we live<S>2198</S>, we live<S>2198</S> unto the Lord<S>2962</S>; and whether<S>1437</S> <S>5037</S> we die<S>599</S>, we die<S>599</S> unto the Lord<S>2962</S>: whether<S>1437</S> <S>5037</S> we live<S>2198</S> therefore<S>3767</S>, or<S>1437</S> <S>5037</S> die<S>599</S>, we are<S>2070</S> the Lord's<S>2962</S>.
For<S>1063</S> to<S>1519</S> this<S>5124</S> end Christ<S>5547</S> both<S>2532</S> died<S>599</S>, and<S>2532</S> rose<S>450</S>, and<S>2532</S> revived<S>326</S>, that<S>2443</S> he might be Lord<S>2961</S> both<S>2532</S> of the dead<S>3498</S> and<S>2532</S> living<S>2198</S>.
But<S>1161</S> why<S>5101</S> dost<S>2919</S> thou<S>4771</S> judge<S>2919</S> thy<S>4675</S> brother<S>80</S>? or<S>2228</S> <S>2532</S> why<S>5101</S> dost<S>1848</S> thou<S>4771</S> set at nought<S>1848</S> thy<S>4675</S> brother<S>80</S>? for<S>1063</S> we shall<S>3936</S> all<S>3956</S> stand before<S>3936</S> the judgment seat<S>968</S> of Christ<S>5547</S>.
For<S>1063</S> it is written<S>1125</S>, As I<S>1473</S> live<S>2198</S>, saith<S>3004</S> the Lord<S>2962</S>,<S>3754</S> every<S>3956</S> knee<S>1119</S> shall bow<S>2578</S> to me<S>1698</S>, and<S>2532</S> every<S>3956</S> tongue<S>1100</S> shall confess<S>1843</S> to God<S>2316</S>.
So<S>3767</S> then<S>686</S> every one<S>1538</S> of us<S>2257</S> shall give<S>1325</S> account<S>3056</S> of<S>4012</S> himself<S>1438</S> to God<S>2316</S>.
Let us<S>2919</S> not therefore<S>3767</S> judge<S>2919</S> one another<S>240</S> any more<S>3371</S>: but<S>235</S> judge<S>2919</S> this<S>5124</S> rather<S>3123</S>, that no man<S>3361</S> put<S>5087</S> a stumblingblock<S>4348</S> or<S>2228</S> an occasion to fall<S>4625</S> in his brother's way<S>80</S>.
I know<S>1492</S>, and<S>2532</S> am persuaded<S>3982</S> by<S>1722</S> the Lord<S>2962</S> Jesus<S>2424</S>, that<S>3754</S> there is nothing<S>3762</S> unclean<S>2839</S> of<S>1223</S> itself<S>1438</S>: but<S>1508</S> to him that esteemeth<S>3049</S> any thing<S>5100</S> to be<S>1511</S> unclean<S>2839</S>, to him<S>1565</S> it is unclean<S>2839</S>. <sup>unclean: Gr. common</sup>
But<S>1161</S> if<S>1487</S> thy<S>4675</S> brother<S>80</S> be grieved<S>3076</S> with<S>1223</S> thy meat<S>1033</S>, now<S>3765</S> walkest thou<S>4043</S> not<S>3765</S> charitably<S>26</S> <S>2596</S>. Destroy<S>622</S> not<S>3361</S> him<S>1565</S> with thy<S>4675</S> meat<S>1033</S>, for<S>5228</S> whom<S>3739</S> Christ<S>5547</S> died<S>599</S>. <sup>charitably: Gr. according to charity</sup>
Let<S>987</S> not<S>3361</S> then<S>3767</S> your<S>5216</S> good<S>18</S> be evil spoken of<S>987</S>:
For<S>1063</S> the kingdom<S>932</S> of God<S>2316</S> is<S>2076</S> not<S>3756</S> meat<S>1035</S> and<S>2532</S> drink<S>4213</S>; but<S>235</S> righteousness<S>1343</S>, and<S>2532</S> peace<S>1515</S>, and<S>2532</S> joy<S>5479</S> in<S>1722</S> the Holy<S>40</S> Ghost<S>4151</S>.
For<S>1063</S> he that in<S>1722</S> these things<S>5125</S> serveth<S>1398</S> Christ<S>5547</S> is acceptable<S>2101</S> to God<S>2316</S>, and<S>2532</S> approved<S>1384</S> of men<S>444</S>.
Let us<S>1377</S> therefore<S>686</S> <S>3767</S> follow after<S>1377</S> the things which make for<S>3588</S> peace<S>1515</S>, and<S>2532</S> things wherewith<S>1519</S> one<S>240</S> may edify<S>3619</S> another<S>240</S>.
For<S>1752</S> meat<S>1033</S> destroy<S>2647</S> not<S>3361</S> the work<S>2041</S> of God<S>2316</S>. All things<S>3956</S> indeed<S>3303</S> are pure<S>2513</S>; but<S>235</S> it is evil<S>2556</S> for that man<S>444</S> who eateth<S>2068</S> with<S>1223</S> offence<S>4348</S>.
It is good<S>2570</S> neither<S>3361</S> to eat<S>5315</S> flesh<S>2907</S>, nor<S>3366</S> to drink<S>4095</S> wine<S>3631</S>, nor<S>3366</S> any thing whereby<S>1722</S> <S>3739</S> thy<S>4675</S> brother<S>80</S> stumbleth<S>4350</S>, or<S>2228</S> is offended<S>4624</S>, or<S>2228</S> is made weak<S>770</S>.
Hast<S>2192</S> thou<S>4771</S> faith<S>4102</S>? have<S>2192</S> it to<S>2596</S> thyself<S>4572</S> before<S>1799</S> God<S>2316</S>. Happy<S>3107</S> is he that condemneth<S>2919</S> not<S>3361</S> himself<S>1438</S> in<S>1722</S> that thing which<S>3739</S> he alloweth<S>1381</S>.
And<S>1161</S> he that doubteth<S>1252</S> is damned<S>2632</S> if<S>1437</S> he eat<S>5315</S>, because<S>3754</S> he eateth not<S>3756</S> of<S>1537</S> faith<S>4102</S>: for<S>1161</S> whatsoever<S>3739</S> <S>3956</S> is not<S>3756</S> of<S>1537</S> faith<S>4102</S> is<S>2076</S> sin<S>266</S>. <sup>doubteth: or, discerneth and putteth a difference between meats</sup> <sup>damned: or, condemned, or liable to punishment</sup>
